reviews.review: I bought it to have textures on Gmod, but this game is actually pretty fun! It introduced me to the Counter Strike series.

Counter Strike Soruce - Review 
Lets begin with the basics :
 - Custom sprays -> MS Paint Competition
 - Weapons do not feel like weapons . The sounds are awful and the deagle is sometimes too OP 
 - Compared to CSGO or any other shooter from 2016+ , the graphics are bad and belongs to the trash bin ( sorry for the terminology but i can't make a better comparisson )
 - The Community can be either toxic or dead , since the majority either went to GO or stayed at 1.6
 - CSS is not that competitive ( there are no ranks ) . There's no felling of '' Wow , I'm GN3 , I'm becoming better '' but there's also no possible way of saying '' You're a noob , i have a higher rank '' . As a result , the game eliminates part of the toxicity but also elimitaes the the feeling of improvement.

I can't say CSS is a bad game since it was one of the main building blocks of CS:GO BUT if you played GO competitively speaking it's better to just find another game. 
If you're just starting to explore the world of gaming , CSS is a good game to begin with since it can run on almost every PC ( potatoes included )
Some of you may say that CS:GO is full of kids . Well , of course if you are only playing in Silver and you never try to improve you're skills and rank up . 
Also , some of the people buy this game only for Gary's Mod so that they don't have purple textures . 

For those that read my review and disagree remember it's my own opinion . If you have anything to tell me like a counter-argument , please write it in the comments so i can read it and maybe after that i'll change my opinion .
Also , being my first serious review , don't be harsh on me :)

Counter-Strike: Source is really good. They revamped almost everything, added some new maps, better graphics compared to CS 1.6, CS: CZ, and CS: CZDS. I would say this is the second best Counter-Strike game in the whole Counter-Strike series. Right now, it makes more sense because now Source is cheaper than Global Offensive, althogh I don't have CSGO yet. Until I can get CSGO, I will make a comparison of both games' pros and cons.
